result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. Seehafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE and/or schooling.
Absolute sobriety (drugs/alcohol).  Only prescription drugs within valid prescription.

Counseling.   

Random UA's.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Seehafer

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 8:55am. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.Deft appears in custody and by Atty Kat Jackan. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to delete repeater- CRT grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct 1 (poss/illegal obtained prescription). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State, Defense.  COURT ORDERS: SWH- 1 yr probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling; AODA; Absolute Sobriety- drugs/alcohol; only prescription drugs within the valid prescription; Random UA's; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Court Costs; DNA Surhcarge.  No day credit on this matter.  Adjourned: 9:06am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 09:40 am.
Final pre-trial on July 9, 2015 at 02:40 pm.
Jury Trial on August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Absolute sobriety (drugs/alcohol) or unless valid prescription for medications.
